title: 2020 Disasters, Technology and the Acceleration of World Culture with Byrne Power
description:
Byrne Power, the Anadromist comes in for an end of year review. 
Byrne's Channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCIAtCuzdvgNJvSYILnHtdWA
Christmas in Georgia

2020 in an alternative manner

What would have been the news in 2020

What do the following countries, have in common: 

Suffered some degree of damage from one of the largest locus infestations in history

Australian wild fires, 

India: massive flooding, huge cyclones, earthquakes, heatwave

128 cyclones, 60 billion in damages

Explosion in Lebanon

Notes on Camp Susan Sontag

One of the first things to leave in time is the taste of the era

An acceleration of eras

That moment in the horror film when they say "Why don't we split up"

What gave donald trump his power? 

L'abri

Jesus people

Christians had no idea what was going on in the world anymore

If you really wanted to tar someone with a good word it was demonic

Pick a phobic… They're not human beings

The second Mad Max film…

He's inside looking out

Often felt like that. Having seen both sides of things.

They're not looking at real people. They're looking at the propagandist view of the people

It's so easy for people to go off their propaganda image. 

Orthodoxy

Douglas Murray talking to Christians, they're having a good conversation

Back to Christendom 

Jonathan Pageau's symbolic journey

Where are the golden ages of Christianity

4th or 5th century Ireland, 17th century Holland

Rookmaker

Cave City 

Haynes AK

Embarrassment of Riches, Simon something, Golden Age of the Netherlands

Ellul, third book of technology

Rookmaker quote: 

David Hoffman: did an interview with Byrne
